intro: Rhynchospora niederleiniana, commonly known as the Niederlein's spike-rush, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the wetlands of South America. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and grass-like plants. The plant typically grows in shallow water or moist soil, forming dense clumps with slender, cylindrical stems. Its inflorescence consists of a single spike of small, three-parted flowers, which are usually pale green to reddish in color. Rhynchospora niederleiniana plays a role in wetland ecosystems by providing habitat and stabilizing soil in aquatic environments.
